intro: Languas babeldaobensis, commonly known as the Babeldaob Island lantana, is a flowering plant native to the island of Babeldaob in the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate with high humidity and salt spray. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Languas babeldaobensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
